get.description: Returns a list of MCP servers for the organization.
Returns the default MCP server for the organization. If not set, it will create a new one.

delete.description: Deletes an MCP server by its ID.

get.description: Returns a list of sandboxes for the organization.

delete.description: Deletes a sandbox by its ID.

get.description: Get the sandbox details by id

post.description: Executes a computer use action on the sandbox.
Takes a screenshot and gets cursor position of the sandbox.

get.description: Returns a list of projects for the organization.

delete.description: Deletes a project by its ID.

post.description: Parses the output text of computer use model and returns the parsed actions.

get.description: Returns the stats of the organization, such as number of members, computers, etc.

createdAt.description: Creation date of the MCP server.

defaultMcpServer.description: Whether this is the default MCP server for the organization.

projectId.description: Project ID to which the MCP server belongs.

sandboxMaxLifetimeSeconds.description: The maximum lifetime of a sandbox.

sandboxMaxIdleTimeSeconds.description: The maximum idle time of a sandbox.

sandboxAutoCreation.description: Whether to create a new sandbox automatically when old sandbox is deleted. If not, new sandboxes will be created when calling computer use tools.

sandboxExposeRecreateTool.description: Whether to expose recreate tool to LLMs.

sandboxExposeRestartTool.description: Whether to expose restart tool to LLMs.

sandboxExposeDeleteTool.description: Whether to expose delete tool to LLMs.

createdAt.description: Creation date of the MCP server.

defaultMcpServer.description: Whether this is the default MCP server for the organization.

projectId.description: Project ID to which the MCP server belongs.

sandboxMaxLifetimeSeconds.description: The maximum lifetime of a sandbox.

sandboxMaxIdleTimeSeconds.description: The maximum idle time of a sandbox.

sandboxAutoCreation.description: Whether to create a new sandbox automatically when old sandbox is deleted. If not, new sandboxes will be created when calling computer use tools.

sandboxExposeRecreateTool.description: Whether to expose recreate tool to LLMs.

sandboxExposeRestartTool.description: Whether to expose restart tool to LLMs.

sandboxExposeDeleteTool.description: Whether to expose delete tool to LLMs.

projectId.description: Project to which the MCP server belongs to.

sandboxMaxLifetimeSeconds.description: The maximum lifetime of a sandbox.

sandboxMaxIdleTimeSeconds.description: The maximum idle time of a sandbox.

sandboxAutoCreation.description: Whether to create a new sandbox automatically when old sandbox is deleted. If not, new sandboxes will be created when calling computer use tools.

sandboxExposeRecreateTool.description: Whether to expose recreate tool to LLMs.

sandboxExposeRestartTool.description: Whether to expose restart tool to LLMs.

sandboxExposeDeleteTool.description: Whether to expose delete tool to LLMs.

maxLifeSeconds.description: The maximum life time of the sandbox in seconds. Default is 1 hour, max is 1 day.

projectId.description: The project id to use for the sandbox. Use default if not provided.

specId.description: The spec of the sandbox. Use default if not provided.

datacenterId.description: The datacenter id to use for the sandbox. Use default if not provided.

action.description: All possible computer use actions, with optional callId

oneOf.description: Click the mouse at the specified coordinates
Double click the mouse at the specified coordinates
Move the mouse to the specified coordinates
Drag the mouse from start to end coordinates

keys.description: Hotkey combination, in xdotool key syntax. Examples: "a", "Return", "alt+Tab", "ctrl+s", "Up", "KP_0" (for the numpad 0 key).

oneOf.description: Take a screenshot of the current screen

screenShot.description: The screenshot of the sandbox after the action is executed.

x.description: The x position of the cursor.

y.description: The y position of the cursor.

model.description: The model to parse the input for

output.description: The response output from the model, if available

items.description: A single item from the model output
